Package Converter

Class MoneyConverter.RetrievedMoney

java.lang.Object
Converter.MoneyConverter.RetrievedMoney
Enclosing class:
MoneyConverter
public static class MoneyConverter.RetrievedMoney extends Object
Represents retrieved money in numeric formats without currency symbols.

This nested static class provides methods to retrieve the raw money as an integer (pence) or as a double (pounds).

  • Constructor Summary

  • Constructor Details

    • RetrievedMoney

      public RetrievedMoney(int money)
      Constructs a RetrievedMoney object.
      Parameters:
      money - the raw money amount in the smallest unit

  • Method Details

    • toPence

      public int toPence()
      Retrieves the money value as an integer representing the smallest unit.

      For example, if the money is set as 250 (representing 250 pence), this will return 250.

      Returns:
      the raw money in smallest units (e.g., pence)

    • toPound

      public double toPound()
      Retrieves the money value as a double representing the main currency unit.

      For example, if the money is 250 pence, this returns 2.50 as a double.

      Returns:
      the money converted to the main unit as a double (e.g., 2.50 for 250 pence)

    • toPound

      public int toPound(boolean state)
      Retrieves the money value as an integer main currency unit, optionally rounded to the nearest whole number.

      If state is true, it rounds the value. If state is false, it truncates.

      Parameters:
      state - true to round the value, false to truncate
      Returns:
      the integer main currency unit value, rounded or truncated
